title: Lost My promo's going to Gold 2, get back no Free win?
body:
Hello, just wanted to see if this happened to anyone else or if there is a time limit to getting the promo helper free win after losing a series. I know that if its a series going for plat or higher u do not get the free win, but i just lost my Gold 2 promos and went down to 26 lp. I got back up to the promo a month later with 3 straight wins (i didnt play ranked in that month) and I do not have my free win.

Is this because of the patch? Or did I just time out for my free promo win?

Oh i did accidently dodge que once cuz i forgot to lock in during my promo's would that have something to do with it as well?

replies.body: Dodging a game in a series will disallow you from getting a free promo helper game in the next series.  We're currently in the process of getting that info added to the support site Ranked Play article.

Since you are already more punished for dodging in your promos than in another game, and since Riot acknowledged there was legitimate reasons to dodge, hence the reduced penalty for dodging the first time (but not in promos, even though these legitimate reasons may happen regardless of promos...), may I ask you to reconsider this decision?

And if not, to elaborate on why it has to be this way?

Thank you :)

I'm on the Player Support team so I don't create/develop our systems - I just know how they work and communicate that out.  Even though I can't change the way it works, I can try to give you the context I have.

Dodging (intentional or not) isn't a good experience for anyone.  It slows down getting into a game, which can at times be a lengthy process to begin with.  From my experience a lot of the time people dodge because they don't get the position or champion that they want (the new champ select experience has helped with that, but it still happens).  Most people only see themselves as being the only ones punished by their dodge, but in reality the wait time that others have to go through to get into a game again is also a pain.  Once or twice I've had people dodge multiple times in a row, and because of that I decided that I didn't want to play that night because of the amount of time that was already sunk doing nothing.  We look at overall pain when designing systems, not only the pain that occurs to that single individual because of their actions.

Unintentionally dodging is still dodging, and if we were to remove or lessen the punishments on it even more people would dodge because there would be no fear of losing something (time, LP, promo series).

As far as I'm aware, there isn't a really good way to tell if someone dodged on purpose or because of issues.  Giving out a free win in a promo series is meant to be a helper for people who go through a series normally and lose, not dodge (intentionally or not).  We'll likely never make a change to that part of the system - mostly due to the fact that it could be abused so heavily if we did have the system set up that way.

This probably isn't an overly satisfying answer - but I hope it at least helps you to understand the reasoning the Leagues team took when creating that part of promo helper. :)

Well, I completely understand your point about others being punished when someone dodges, and why the system cannot and should not differentiate between intentional and unintentional dodges. But it has nothing to do with my initial point.

What I meant was: if you dodge (intentionally or not) a "standard" game, you only lose 3 LP and suffer a 5 min penalty. It's far from being as punishing as a full loss.*
On the other hand, if you dodge during a promo series, you suffer a full loss for this series. It's obviously to avoid tricking the system and only choosing to play easy games for your series, and no one's complaining about that. But if you do dodge during your series, you are already dealing with a harsher than usual penalty. So if in addition to that, you also suffer from losing the free win for your next series, it really feels like a triple punishment, and it doesn't seem fair. Plus, as you stated yourself, it's not very intuitive and it's not written in the tooltip that pops in-game about dodges (yet?).

I hope it's clearer now, and I'm sorry for the misunderstanding earlier. Could you relay my concerns to whomever seems appropriate?

Thanks :)

*(If I remember correctly, someone from Riot once said that the first dodge wasn't very punishing because there are legitimate reasons to dodge (intentionally), but that's not the point here.)
I'll make sure someone on the League team sees this suggestion - but I do want to stress that this likely won't change because it's built to be part of the dodging punishment.

I understand, no promise attached, of course. But I still think a triple punishment may be beyond what was initially intended, so knowing that someone on the right team will see that is much appreciated. :)

Seems overly harsh as no one wants to dodge a promo in the first place and the loss of a game is much worse already than 3 lp or whatever in normal ranked games.

If someone dodges a promo it was probably like a real life situation came up.


Also dodging out of a game with like a teemo support is more of a public service to the team

Well the new champ select has certainly helped with intentional dodging, but despite this the actuall amount of dodging has drastically increased. People forget to lock, even when they are completely aware that they have to (talking from experience there)

Of course when new changes happen it will take a little time to get used to them.  

I think for the most part people have learned that locking in will cause a dodge, so it happens less than in the first week - and will continue to go down as time goes on.

It's something that we'll continue to keep track of and potentially make changes if it does continue to be a big issue.

Alright thanks Hollymonster on that info, even tho it wasnt on purpose (because i was debating one or two champions and was still use to the old system since i took a break from the game at preseason, figured it was automatically gonna lock in my champ i was on while hovering over another)

I understand why and if it wasn't this way i could see people abusing the free win system. Thanks again for your time!

I got trolled twice. I was in champ select when a game invite went through I pressed "yes" automatically which resulted in champ select stopping, everyone disconnecting and me dodging eventually.

And after that I won a game and also didn't get my free win :'(

Well I was in my promo for Plat, Lost it. It said I was getting a free win to help me next time I get back in the promo. And here I am again, but no free win. I never dodge a queue or even get reported for anything. So I am curious as to how this happen. {{item:3070}}
this would have helped me sooo much climbing last year XD
Dodging during your series promo does count as an automatic loss.

Well i know that, but i was wondering if that would cause me not to obtain the free win via the promo helper system.

I went into my promo's first time, lost first game then accidently dodged 2nd game (lost promo's) then went down to 26 LP ~ and now im back in without the free win.
